alert.note: Alert for Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 8:23PM EDT until April 20 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Kinston affecting Lenoir County. For the Neuse River...including Kinston, Fort Barnwell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River At Kinston. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water overflows into lowlands adjacent to the river. Water access docks are also affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EDT Monday was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday evening and continue falling to 13.4 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 03/15/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps.
